Package de.haw.common

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
de.haw.common.Matrix
public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Matrix​(int rowSize)
    Creates a mxn matrix of size (rowSize)x(rowSize+1), and initializes all elements as double values, "0.0".

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getRow​(int index)
    Returns the row of the matrix at the designated index.
    int getSize()
    Gets the size of the matrix, specifically the number of rows.
    double getValue​(int row, int column)
    Gets the value at the designated location, the intersection of the row and column.
    void print()
    Prints matrix to the console.
    void setRow​(int index, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> newRow)
    Replace a row in the matrix with a new row.
    boolean setSize​(int size)
    Sets a new size for the matrix.
    boolean setValue​(int row, int column, double value)
    Sets a specific value at a specific location, the designated row and column.
    void swapRows​(int rowA, int rowB)
    Swaps two rows in the matrix.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Matrix

      public Matrix​(int rowSize)
      Creates a mxn matrix of size (rowSize)x(rowSize+1), and initializes all elements as double values, "0.0".
      Parameters:
      rowSize - The desired number of rows (== linear equations).

  • Method Details

    • setValue

      public boolean setValue​(int row, int column, double value)
      Sets a specific value at a specific location, the designated row and column. The value at the specified location is only changed if the row and column numbers are valid.
      Parameters:
      row - The target row.
      column - The target column.
      value - The new value to be set at the specified location.
      Returns:
      True if the value was changed, and False otherwise.

    • getValue

      public double getValue​(int row, int column)
      Gets the value at the designated location, the intersection of the row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The target row.
      column - The target column.
      Returns:
      The double value at the designated location.

    • setSize

      public boolean setSize​(int size)
      Sets a new size for the matrix. If the new size is smaller than the current size, reduces the size of the matrix. If the new size is larger than the current size, increases the size of the matrix. Nothing happens if the new size is the same as the current size.
      Parameters:
      size -
      Returns:
      True if the matrix is changed and the size is increased or decreased, False if no change is made.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Gets the size of the matrix, specifically the number of rows.
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the matrix.

    • setRow

      public void setRow​(int index, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> newRow)
      Replace a row in the matrix with a new row.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the row to be replaced.
      newRow - The new row to take the place of the old.

    • getRow

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Double> getRow​(int index)
      Returns the row of the matrix at the designated index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the row to be returned.
      Returns:
      The designated row.

    • swapRows

      public void swapRows​(int rowA, int rowB)
      Swaps two rows in the matrix.
      Parameters:
      rowA - The first row.
      rowB - The second row.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints matrix to the console.
